intro: Amphorogyne spicata, commonly known as the spicate amphorogyne, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spicate inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with compound leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. Its botanical features include a woody stem, opposite leaf arrangement, and berries that contain the seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
